meanings.sent1: She kept miscoloring the picture, using the wrong crayons.
meanings.sent2: The artist accidentally miscolored the sky green instead of blue.
meanings.sent3: The miscoloring of the walls made the room look like a rainbow gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her miscoloring of the dress turned it into a vibrant mess of hues.
meanings.sent5: The miscoloring of the map led the travelers astray.

meanings.definition: The act of coloring something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The miscoloring of the flowers made them look unnatural.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the miscoloring on the edges of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The miscoloring in the coloring book made the characters look funny.
meanings.sent4: The miscoloring of the flag symbolized a nation in chaos.
meanings.sent5: The miscoloring of the cake made it a colorful disaster.
